DOC.brief_summary: Human papillomavirus ( HPV ) -based cervical screening know increase sensitivity detection high-grade cervical intraepithelial neoplasia ( CIN ) . Randomized trial longitudinal efficacy require ass whether gain represent overdiagnosis protective effect . Methods : A total 12527 woman , age 32-38 , attend population-based invitational screening Sweden randomize 1:1 HPV test cytology ( intervention arm ) cytology ( control arm ) . HPV-positive woman invite second HPV test least one year later woman type-specific persistent infection invite colposcopy . A similar number random double-blinded procedure perform control arm . Women follow comprehensive registry-based follow-up . Primary outcome relative rate CIN grade 2 worse ( CIN2/CIN3+ ) find subsequent screening . Secondary outcomes relative rate CIN2/CIN3+ find aseline screen outcome stratify grade CIN ( CIN 2 CIN3+ ) .
DOC.brief_title: Randomized Controlled Trial Human Papillomavirus Testing Primary Cervical Cancer Screening
DOC.criteria: Women age 3238 year old Attending Swedish populationbased organised cervical screen program Not provide inform consent
